page.title: 13FARMING YEAR IN ESKDALEMUIR
page.content: On the hill farms of Eskdalemuir cattle as well as sheep are raised in substantial numbers, partially wintered indoors during the extremely cold months. The main breed,the Black Galloway is mated to a White Shorthorn bull, producing Blue-Grey calves.Fewer in number are the Friesian Heifers mated to the Hereford bull. There is little or no grain harvest. Hay and silage are procured ,weather permitting. Technology plays a major part in the mechanised method of farming in the 1980's. Rotavators break up the soil,harrows level the ground.The spinner broadcaster sews grass seed and fertiliser.The turbo mower cuts the grass ,the haybob teds and rakes .The baler-handler takes in the bales.
